# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text, ' ')
        if length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, word)
        elseif length(join(lines, "")) + length(word) <= text_width
            push!(lines, word)
        else
            # We need to add a new line because the current line will exceed the limit
            push!(lines, "")
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there this is a very long string that should be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width = 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function will output something like:

```
Hello there this is a very long
string that should be wrapped into
multiple lines.
```
